Key: Mmm... Morning already.

(I woke up feeling very refreshed. I still can't
believe that we're inside of a game.)

If I'm not careful, I'll forget the difference.
As well as why I'm in here in the first place.
That's almost a compliment for the game.
Zzz...

(As expected of a game made by Ratatoskr.
It's almost a waste of technology.)

I feel like I read a manga about that recently.
It was something and the "Room of Time,
I think."
...Zzzz...
(Hmmm...)

I should probably check in with the real
world now. This bed is awfully comfy,
but I think I hear someone close to me...

(Just like yesterday, I felt a very soft
sensation.)
This sensation. Could it be...?

Ahh, I knew it. I wonder if she crawled back
in this morning. Or if it was when we went
our separate ways last night.

(Even though I asked her not to before we went
to bed...)

Well, she didn't agree to it herself, so it's
not her fault. Either way, I gotta wake up
Maria. I don't want another freak-out.
Hey. Wake up, Maria. I said wake up.
(She won't wake...)

Maria, please wake up. It's morning.
Please, open your eyes soon.
Or else Kotori's gonna come in again.

(Hmm. Didn't seem to work. I'll either have
to shake her or she won't wake. Here it goes...)
Try shaking her awake.
Try poking her cheek.
Hm... For now, I'll try shaking her.
Maria, wake up.
Mariaaa.

(Maria sure is light and soft. Just like a
real girl.)
...Wha?! No no no!

(Damn it. Begone, evil thoughts! All I want
to do is wake up Maria!)
Maria, please, wake up...
Mm...mmm...

(I'm afraid of touching her body, so what
should I do?)

Hmm. I wonder if poking her cheek is okay.
It's just her face, so I'm sure she'll wake up
quickly... All right.

(I've made my decision. All I need to do
is follow through.)
Here goes nothing... YAH!
Mrgh...

(Oh. She reacted that time. Am I on the
right track?)
All right. One more time. Oryah!
Please...do not...Shido...

She's not fully awake, I guess. Is Maria
dreaming?

(Wait. Can Maria even dream in the first place?
If she can sleep, I guess it isn't beyond the
realm of possibility that she could dream.)

Well, that's irrelevant. Anyways, I have to
wake her. One more time!
Shido...you are...mean...

That pillow talk would be terrifying if someone
were to overhear.

(It's no use. No matter what I do, she shows no
sign of waking. In fact, I feel like this whole
thing turned out weirder than I wanted it to.)

Can't be helped. Guess I need my last resort.
I wanted to avoid it at all costs, but...

(There was only one way to do it. A technique
that was sure to wake Maria.)

(However, doing so would surely ruin Maria's
restful sleep. It might even hurt. But I can't
delay any longer. Maria, don't hate me!)
Here I go!

(Allow me to explain. This technique involves
suffocating the target, only slightly, to jolt
them awake. I'm only using blankets, though.)

...Mmm?
Mm, mrph, urf!
(Ah, is it working?)
Ah. Whew. It seems as though I'm safe.
Morning, Maria. You slept in.

Organizing all of that data took up time. It is
much later than when I set my alarm to go off.

Well, I'm glad you're awake. Let's go to the
living room and eat.
It is already that time, I see. Understood.

(Maria looked at the clock, and seemingly
understood the situation.)

Listen, Maria. I need you to stop climbing
into my bed from now on.

Um, sorry to interrupt, but why are you two
still in bed?
Kotori?!
Good morning, Kotori Itsuka.

Good morning, Arusu. And you too, Shido.
I see she crawled in again, just like
yesterday.
Yeah. Seems like it.

Well, I have no intention of throwing a fit,
but take responsibility and watch after her,
okay?

(She shrugged and left, closing the door behind
her.)
Shido, do we not have to go?
Yeah. You don't have to ask, we're going.
(Somehow or another, another day has begun.)
